newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Intel trading higher.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Intel trading higher.

text.p: Intel Corp was trading slightly higher after the bell on Thursday, after falling 4-1/8 during regular trading on a day when it launched its latest chip.
"It's up a quarter" to 145-5/8, one trader said. Intel had closed at 145-3/8. The company introduced its new MMX multimedia computer chip earlier Thursday.
Other high-tech stocks, such as Sun Microsystems Inc and Oracle Corp, were also trading after-hours, but their prices were unchanged from where they closed.
Traders "are just wrapping things up" from the day rather than generating new market momentum, one trader said.
Sun Microsystems closed at 30-1/2, up 1-1/8 for the day. Oracle closed at 36-9/16, down 3-3/16 for the day.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one volume was 5,900, compared with 19,400 on Wednesday. Session two volume was 17,823,703, while on Wednesday it was 3,674,240.
